bibliographic_metadata.Title: Regional-Scale Mineral Prospectivity Mapping: Support Vector Machines and an Improved Data-Driven Multi-criteria Decision-Making Technique
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Reza Ghezelbash, Abbas Maghsoudi, Amirreza Bigdeli, Emmanuel John M. Carranza

abstract: This paper aims to reduce uncertainties in mineral prospectivity mapping (MPM) for Cu-Au mineralization in the Moalleman District, NE Iran. Efficient evidence layers were translated from geospatial criteria and integrated using an improved data-driven simple additive weight (SAW) procedure. A support vector machine (SVM) with radial basis function kernel was also applied for comparison. Results indicated that both models successfully delineated favorable mineralization targets, with SVM proving more reliable.
methodology: supervised > kernel-based > support vector machine; supervised > tree-based > random forest

dataset.scope: Training from known deposits to application in the Moalleman District

key_points: The study introduces an improved data-driven MCDM technique for mineral prospectivity mapping.
Support vector machines (SVM) were utilized for classification and comparison with traditional methods.
The SVM model demonstrated higher reliability in predicting mineralization targets.
Efficient exploration criteria significantly enhance the accuracy of predictive models.
The study highlights the importance of data-driven weights to reduce systematic uncertainty.
